query: Q59. When plotting multiple layouts, you can use the Batch Plotting (PUBLISH) command. What type of file can be saved to retain the batch plotting settings?
options:
Batch Plotting Description (BPD)
 file Drawing Publishing Description (DPD)
 file Batch Sheet Description (BSD)
 file Drawing Set Description (DSD) file

query: Q60. To create clean, professional plots of your drawings, which object should be set to not plot in the Layer Properties Manager palette?

Q61. Selection cycling can be used to select an object that shares concurrent geometry with another object. Which AutoCAD system variable needs to be used, and what value needs to be set, to ensure that selection cycling is switched on and the dialog box appears?
options:
SELECTIONCYCLING = 0
 SELECTIONCYCLING = 2
 SELECTIONCYCLING = 1
 Press Ctrl+W (Windows) or Command+W (Mac).

query: Q62. Splines use the NURBS algorithm in AutoCAD. What does NURBS stand for?
options:
Non-Unified Rotated Bend Spline
 Non-United Rotational Bend Spline
 Non-Uniform Rational Basis Spline
 Not Uniform Rotational Build Spline

query: Q63. You can freeze layers in a current viewport in a layout tab. This is done by activating the viewport and selecting the layers to be frozen either in the Layer drop-down menu or the Layer Properties Manager. Which layer setting makes sure that layers are automatically frozen in any new viewports?
options:
VP Freeze
 Freeze in Viewport
 Freeze in New Viewport
 New VP Freeze

query: Q64. When using multiline text in a drawing, you can import text from other applications using the Import Text command. Application-neutral text, TXT format, can be imported this way. What other types of text that preserve formatting and fonts can you import?
options:
Simplex (SHX) text
 Microsoft Word text in a TrueType (TTF) font
 Rich Text Format (RTF) text
 any other type of text apart from TXT text

query: Q65. When using the MOVE command from the right-click shortcut menu, why are you automatically asked to select a base point for your move?
options:
The object(s) is selected automatically after the base point is selected.
 The object(s) automatically associates into a group once you have selected the base point.
 You are asked to select the object(s) after the base point is selected.
 You have already selected the object(s) to move.

query: Q66. You can use Polar Tracking to rotate objects when using the ROTATE command. What would you need to set to control the angle?
options:
Set the Grid and Snap settings.
 Set up the running object snaps.
 Set the Polar Tracking increment angle.
 Set up object snap tracking.

query: Q67. When working with annotative text styles and dimension styles in model space, what two values must match for the annotative annotation to display in the corresponding viewports in the layout tab?
options:
annotation scale and linetype scale
 linetype scale and viewport scale
 annotation scale and viewport scale
 insertion scale and annotation scale

query: Q68. The SCALE command needs a scale factor in order to function. The value has to be a positive integer. If you use a scale factor of 2, what does this value represent?
options:
two times bigger in the X direction (200%
 twice as big (200%)
 two percent bigger (2%)
 half as big (50%)

query: Q69. Which keys can you press to repeat your last-used AutoCAD command?
options:
the Page Up key or the Page Down key
 the R key or the C key
 the Tab key
 the Spacebar or the Enter (Windows) or Return (Mac) key

query: Q70. When using the Polyline (PLINE) command to draw an arrowhead, what polyline properties do you need to use?
options:
the Halfwidth setting
 starting width and ending widths
 polyline start and polyline end
 the START and END variables in the PLINE command

query: Q71. Where do you perform the majority of drawing tasks in AutoCAD?
options:
innerspace
 paper space
 layout space
 model space

query: Q72. To plot the same drawing with the same settings each time, what needs to be set up in AutoCAD?
options:
the Output tab
 the Plot dialog boxt
 batch plotting
 Page Setup Manager (Windows) or Page Setup (Mac)

query: Q73. Using the Array command, you have the option to create an associative array. What does this mean?
options:
When dimensioning an array, the dimensions displayed are associative.
 The arrayed objects becomes a single entity and, when selected, display as a single entity.
 The arrayed objects become associated to the X and Y coordinates used for the array.
 The array is associated to the linetype scale.

query: Q74. When drawing a Start, Center, End arc, which key do you press to draw the arc in a clockwise direction?
